pageContext.description: Broad midrib and bevel round cutting edge. 6 Rivet holes and notches; only one of these is not actually broken into. Hilt plate is damaged. The blade has been broken, possibly intentionally with a to and fro movement and been soldered in modern times.
pageContext.patina: Dark brown patina and some bright green.
pageContext.surface: Fairly smooth, some corroded pits and lumps.
pageContext.other: Width: blade at section 34mm; hilt plate 80mm
pageContext.publications: Annual Records Catalogue, 1911,Cambridge Antiquarian Society Catalogue,B.A.V. Trump, P.P.S., 1962, No. 5, p. 98, no. 233,Rowlands, 1976, no. 1884, pl. 43,Dobson, 1931, 83, 247 (cat.)
